intro: Eriospermum andongense, commonly known as the Andong eriosperm, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible parts. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of lanceolate leaves and produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
